Objective: No tranportation projects over $50 million will be programmed without comprehensive corridor land use plan
Indicator: Comprehensive corridor planning for transportation projects over $50 million

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Regional transportation planning will be linked with sustainable land use
Objective: Funding for community -based transit such as shuttle service and on-demand services will be at least 5% of the total transportation budget.
Indicator: Proportion of total transportaiton budget spent on community-based transit

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Regional transportation planning will be linked with sustainable land use
Objective: Funding for sidewalks, bike paths, and rail trails and transporation demand management programs will be at least 5% of the total transportation budget.
Indicator: Proportion of total transportation budget spent on sidewalks, bike paths, rail trails, and transportation demand management

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Regional transportation planning will be linked with sustainable land use
Objective: Funding for expansion of transit network (subways, bus, and commuter rail) will be a greater proportion of the region's transportation budget than is spend on roadway expansion projects.
Indicator: Funding for transit network expansion; funding for roadway expansion projects

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: The transportation system will be reliably funded and transportation agencies will demonstrate accountability to the public
Objective: The region will complete 95% of maintenance targets annually
Indicator: Proportion of maintenance targets completed each year

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: The transportation system will be reliably funded and transportation agencies will demonstrate accountability to the public
Objective: 95% of roadway maintenance and transit maintenance funding will be allocated according to the priorities of a comprehensive  transportation asset management system.
Indicator: Proportion of roadway maintenance and transit maintence funding allocated according to a comprehensive transportation asset management system

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: The transportation system will be reliably funded and transportation agencies will demonstrate accountability to the public
Objective: There will be a steady decrease in the MBTA debt service costs
Indicator: Amount of MBTA debt service

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: The transportation system will be reliably funded and transportation agencies will demonstrate accountability to the public
Objective: A growing share of transportation funding in the region will come from user fees and value capture costs
Indicator: Proportion of transportation funding from user fees and value capture costs

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Transportation projects will be designed and built quickly and cost effectively
Objective: 90% of transportation infrastructure projects will be complete on time and within budget
Indicator: Proportion of transportation infrastructure completed on time and within budget

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Roads, bridges, and railways will be safe and well maintained
Objective: At least 70% of state-maintained roads will be in good repair
Indicator: Proportion of state-maintained roads in good repair

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Roads, bridges, and railways will be safe and well maintained
Objective: 90% of auto-crashes will be cleared from the roadway within 90 minutes
Indicator: Proportion of auto crashes cleared from roadway within 90 minutes

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Roads, bridges, and railways will be safe and well maintained
Objective: The number of structurally deficient bridges will not increase
Indicator: Number of structurally deficient bridges

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: Roads, bridges, and railways will be safe and well maintained
Objective: All municipalities will have a pavement management system in place
Indicator: Pavement management systems in all municipalities

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: The region's businesses will access the global marketplace through an efficient freight transportation network
Objective: 15% of the region's freight will travel by rail
Indicator: Proportion of region's freight traveling by rail

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: The region's businesses will access the global marketplace through an efficient freight transportation network
Objective: The Port of Boston will be fully connected to the regional rail network
Indicator: Connection of the Port of Boston to regional rail network

Subject: Getting Around
Goal: The average person will drive fewer miles every day
Objective: Commute times will decline.
Indicator: Commute times.

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: Families looking for suburban single-family homes will have a greater choice of smaller homes in more traditional neighborhood settings.
Objective: By 2030, there will be 17,500 new suburban single-family homes less than  1,700 square feet and/or on lots 1/4 of an acre or smaller.
Indicator: New housing units on lots smaller than 1/4 acre.
Existing Data Source: Census: American Housing Survey, McConnell Land Use Survey

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: Families looking for suburban single-family homes will have a greater choice of smaller homes in more traditional neighborhood settings.
Objective: Average lot size for new single-family houses in suburban communities would be 0.75 acres (0.62 acres in Maturing Suburbs, and 0.79 acres in Developing Suburbs.)
Indicator: Median lot size of new single-family houses
Existing Data Source: Warren Group / MIT Center for Real Estate

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: The region will produce 350,000 new housing units by 2030.
Indicator: Number of New Units

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: The region will produce 350,000 new housing units by 2030.

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: The regional affordability gap will be eliminated by 2030, for households earning 80%, 100%, and 120% of area median income.
Indicator: Median home price (by type) vs. median household income

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: There will be an increasing number of municipalities in which local median housing costs (ownership and rental) are equal to or less than 30% of regional median income.
Indicator: Number of municipalities where local median housing costs are equal to or less than 30% of regional median income

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: Ownership housing units with monthly costs less than 30% of regional monthly median income will comprise a growing share of the region's housing stock.
Indicator: Share of housing stock comprised of ownership housing units with monthly costs less than 30% of regional monthly median income

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: Rental housing units costing less than 30% of regional median income will comprise a growing share of the region's housing stock.
Indicator: Share of housing stock comprised of rental housing units costing less than 30% of regional median income

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: There will be 97,000 new starter homes (single-family homes <1,700 square feet; single-family attached; 2-4 family homes) by 2030
Indicator: Number of single-family homes <1,700 square feet or single-family attached; 2-4 family homes build

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: Foreclosure rates should decline.
Indicator: Foreclosure rates

Subject: Housing Choices

Objective: The demographic spread of each municipality will approach the demographic spread of the region.

Objective: Home purchase loans will be denied at rates that increasingly reflect the regions demographics, contolling for income.

Subject: Housing Choices

Subject: Housing Choices
Goal: Low-income households will be able to find affordable, adequate, conveniently located  housing and avoid displacement.

Goal: Low-income households will be able to find affordable, adequate, conveniently located  housing and avoid displacement.
Objective: 66% of new deed-restricted affordable housing units will be located within 1/2 mile of fixed-route transit service.

Goal: Homelessness will be effectively eliminated from the region.

Subject: Prosperity

Subject: Prosperity

Indicator: Total regional employment

Subject: Prosperity
Goal: The region will be globally competitive in the knowledge economy.
Objective: Sectors that require a more highly skilled workforce will grow faster than the region's employment overall.

Subject: Prosperity
Goal: The region will be globally competitive in the knowledge economy.

Subject: Prosperity

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: Most new growth will occur through reuse of previously developed land and buildings.
Objective: 61% of new residential development in the region (measured in terms of housing units) will occur on land that is already developed.
Indicator: housing units on redevelopment land

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: In suburban municipalities, most new growth will occur near town and village centers.
Objective: 67% of housing unit growth in Maturing Suburbs will be concentrated near town/village centers or commercial districts.
Indicator: Population growth in CODAs of Maturing Suburbs
Geography: Community Type, Municipality, TAZ or Census Tract

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: In suburban municipalities, most new growth will occur near town and village centers.
Objective: 47% of housing unit growth in Developing Suburbs will be concentrated near town/village centers or commercial districts
Indicator: Housing unit growth in CODAs of Developing Suburbs
Geography: Community Type, Municipality, TAZ or Census Tract

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: In suburban municipalities, most new growth will occur near town and village centers.
Objective: 64% of new Suburban job growth would occur near existing employment centers.
Indicator: Job growth in CODAs of Maturing Suburbs and Developing Suburbs
Geography: Community Type, Municipality, TAZ or Census Tract

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: In suburban municipalities, most new growth will occur near town and village centers.
Objective: 25% of Suburban housing units and 6% of Suburban jobs will be in mixed-use developments.
Indicator: Housing unit and job growth in mixed-use developments
Geography: Community Type, Municipality, TAZ or Census Tract

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: Most new houses and jobs will be near train stops and bus routes, and new growth will be designed to promote transit use.
Objective: 66% of new housing units regionwide will be within 1 mile of fixed-route transit service
Indicator: Housing unit growth within 1 mile buffer of MBTA commuter rail and rapid transit stations
Relevant: No new T stops created since map

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: Most new houses and jobs will be near train stops and bus routes, and new growth will be designed to promote transit use.
Objective: 70% of new commercial and industrial development (measured in number of jobs created) will be within 1 mile of fixed-route transit service
Indicator: Employment growth within 1 mile buffer of MBTA commuter rail and rapid transit stations
Relevant: No new T stops created since map

Subject: Sustainable Growth Patterns
Goal: Most new houses and jobs will be near train stops and bus routes, and new growth will be designed to promote transit use.
Objective: 75% of new development within 1/2 mile of rapid transit will be at densities of at least 50 people/jobs per developed acre
Indicator: Density of development within 1/2 mile buffer of MBTA commuter rail and rapid transit stations
Relevant: No new T stops created since map

Goal: More minority and immigrant workers have the opportunities to advance on the career ladder, acquire assets, and build wealth
Objective: Homeownership rates will increasingly reflect the regions demographics, controlled for income
Indicator: Homeownership rates by income group

Goal: More minority and immigrant workers have the opportunities to advance on the career ladder, acquire assets, and build wealth
Objective: The percentage of home loans that are subprime loans will decrease.
Indicator: Home loans by interest rate.

Goal: More students will graduate from high school and go on to college or career training opportunities.
Objective: Droupout rates in the region will decline.
Indicator: Dropout rates by grade

Goal: Cities, towns, and neighborhoods will retain their sense of uniqueness and community character.
Objective: Something on the concentration of bank owned properties

Goal: An increasing share of housing in each municipality will be affordable to working families and fixed income seniors.
Objective: Fewer households in the region will be cost burdened.

Goal: There will be less regional segregation as all municipalities increasingly reflect Metro Boston’s growing diversity.
Objective: The dissimilarity index will steadily decline [something about geographies?] [same as 15.x?]

Subject: Community Vitality
Goal: All residents will have access to affordable healthcare and better health outcomes
Objective: The difference between birth weight outcomes of Black/African American and Latina women and the regional average will steadily decline.
Indicator: Low birth weight

Objective: Premature mortality rates in the region will decline
Indicator: Premature Mortality Rates

Goal: All residents will have access to affordable healthcare and better health outcomes
Objective: The difference between premature mortality rates of Black/African Americans and the regional average will steadily decline.

Subject: Community Vitality
Goal: Public schools will provide a high-quality education for all students, not only in the fundamentals, but also in areas like health education, physical education, art, music, civics, and science.

Indicator: Attendance of High-Poverty Schools
